articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Democrats Question Biden's 2024 Re-Election Bid Amid Debate Concerns
articles.description: Some Democrats have started questioning President Joe Biden's re-election bid following his faltering debate performance against Donald Trump. With pressure mounting from donors and party members, Biden is set to meet with Democratic governors and Capitol Hill leaders to reassure them of his capability. A potential ABC interview may be crucial.
articles.content: Some elected Democrats loyal to President Joe Biden raised fresh questions on Tuesday about his 2024 re-election bid, with one calling for him to step aside, a shift after many defended him in the wake of last week's shaky debate performance. Whether... [4231 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Anti-Abortion Group Warns Trump on GOP Platform Language
articles.description: A leading U.S. anti-abortion group has warned Donald Trump against weakening GOP platform language on abortion restrictions. The group, led by Marjorie Dannenfelser, is concerned the platform may exclude federal abortion restrictions, threatening party unity and pro-life enthusiasm before the election. Evangelical leaders also urge Trump to maintain stricter abortion language.

articles.title: Judge delays Trump’s hush money sentencing until at least September after high court immunity ruling
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump’s sentencing in his hush money case has been postponed until at least Sept. 18. articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Outraises Biden in Q2 Fundraising Battle
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign raised $331 million in the second quarter, surpassing President Joe Biden's $264 million. Biden's total included a record haul amid debate controversies. Both campaigns have significant cash reserves, with Trump's campaign thriving on voter enthusiasm and Biden's team focusing on grassroots support.

articles.title: Trump Outraises Biden in Second Quarter Campaign Fundraising Battle
articles.description: Donald Trump's campaign reported raising $331 million in the second quarter, surpassing President Joe Biden's $264 million. Trump's campaign ended the quarter with $284.9 million cash on hand, compared to Biden's $240 million. The figures could weaken Biden's efforts to calm fears within his party.
articles.content:
Donald Trump's campaign declared a financial victory in the year's second quarter, claiming to have outraised President Joe Biden with a reported total of $331 million.
